intro: Dalechampia pseudoclematis, commonly known as the false clematis, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
